description: From Middle English doutable, from Old French doutable, dotable, equivalent to doubt +â€Ž -able.

adjectives.description: doubtable (comparative more doubtable, superlative most doubtable)

entries.meaning: (uncommon) Capable of being doubted; doubtful; dubious; dubitable. See usage notes below.
examples: Descartes adopts the tool of a radical skepticism, submitting to question established beliefs, exposing them to the test of doubt, breaking them down when they prove doubtable.
